skill.name: async-python-patterns
skill.description: Master Python asyncio, concurrent programming, and async/await patterns for high-performance applications. Use when building async APIs, concurrent systems, or I/O-bound applications requiring non-blocking operations.
skill.summary: Master Python asyncio, concurrent programming, and async/await patterns for high-performance applica...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing Python async programming patterns. Static analyzer flagged 77 findings, all confirmed as false positives. Markdown code fences were misidentified as shell backticks. Documentation text was misidentified as cryptographic algorithms. Example URLs are standard placeholders. No executable code, network access, or security risks exist.

content.value_statement: Build high-performance Python applications with async/await patterns. Learn concurrent programming techniques for scalable I/O-bound systems.
actual_capabilities: Shows concurrent task execution with gather()
Covers error handling in async code
Provides real-world examples for web scraping and APIs
limitations: Educational content only - no code execution
Focuses on I/O-bound patterns, not CPU-bound

use_cases.title: Build Async Web APIs
use_cases.description: Create FastAPI and aiohttp applications with proper async patterns for handling concurrent requests

use_cases.title: Concurrent Data Processing
use_cases.description: Implement parallel I/O operations for database queries, file processing, and API calls

use_cases.title: Async Automation Scripts
use_cases.description: Write efficient automation tools that handle multiple network operations concurrently

prompt_templates.title: Basic Async Pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to create a simple async function that fetches data with asyncio.sleep() to simulate network delay

prompt_templates.title: Concurrent Requests
prompt_templates.prompt: Demonstrate how to make 10 HTTP requests concurrently using asyncio.gather() with proper error handling

prompt_templates.title: Producer-Consumer Queue
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a producer-consumer pattern using asyncio.Queue for processing 100 items with 5 workers

prompt_templates.title: WebSocket Server
prompt_templates.prompt: Design an async WebSocket server that handles multiple clients and broadcasts messages to all connected users

output_examples.input: Show me how to fetch multiple URLs concurrently with timeout handling
output: Use asyncio.gather() with asyncio.wait_for() for timeout control
Create aiohttp ClientSession with connection pooling
Handle both successful responses and timeouts gracefully
Return results with status codes and error information

output_examples.input: How do I implement a rate limiter for API calls
output: Use asyncio.Semaphore to limit concurrent requests
Apply semaphore with async context manager pattern
Set appropriate max_concurrent value based on API limits
Combine with retry logic for robustness

output_examples.input: What are common mistakes when writing async Python code
output: Forgetting to await coroutines - they return coroutine objects, not results
Using time.sleep() instead of asyncio.sleep() - blocks the event loop
Not handling task cancellation with try/except CancelledError
Mixing sync and async code without proper wrapping

best_practices: Always use asyncio.run() as the entry point for async applications
Implement proper error handling with try/except blocks in async functions
Use connection pools and semaphores to limit concurrent operations
anti_patterns: Never use time.sleep() in async code - always use asyncio.sleep()
Do not forget to await coroutines or they will not execute
Avoid mixing blocking I/O operations with async code

faq.question: Which Python versions support asyncio?
faq.answer: Python 3.4+ has asyncio, but Python 3.7+ is recommended for async/await syntax and asyncio.run()

faq.question: When should I use async versus threads?
faq.answer: Use async for I/O-bound operations, threads for CPU-bound tasks that block the event loop

faq.question: Can I use async with Django?
faq.answer: Django 3.0+ supports async views, but use Django 4.1+ for full async ORM support

faq.question: How do I debug async code?
faq.answer: Use asyncio debug mode, proper logging, and tools like aiomonitor for production debugging

faq.question: What is the difference between create_task and gather?
faq.answer: create_task() schedules a single coroutine, gather() runs multiple coroutines concurrently and waits for all

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Jupyter notebooks?
faq.answer: Yes, but use asyncio.run() carefully in notebooks - consider using nest_asyncio for nested event loops
